comments:
I get the exception below when a particular class is compiled in my Eclipse AJDT project. I cannot reproduce the problem in a clean environment, so I don't know exactly what triggers it, but the issue prevents me from compiling my project.

java.lang.ClassCastException
at org.aspectj.ajdt.internal.compiler.lookup.EclipseResolvedMember.getParameterNames(EclipseResolvedMember.java:98)
at org.aspectj.weaver.ResolvedMemberImpl.parameterizedWith(ResolvedMemberImpl.java:660)
at org.aspectj.weaver.ResolvedMemberImpl.parameterizedWith(ResolvedMemberImpl.java:597)
at org.aspectj.weaver.ReferenceType.getDeclaredFields(ReferenceType.java:381)
at org.aspectj.weaver.ResolvedType$2.get( ... s 
when weaving 
when batch building BuildConfig[D:\leica\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.ajdt.core\brunswick-core.generated.lst] #Files=731

It seems that the problem was caused by my anonymous inner classes. My class returns an anonymous inner class from a method, which again returns another anonymous inner class from one of its methods. I commented out all anonymous inner classes and then I could build. Then I put the anonymous inner classes back in, and the build still works. So there is a workaround, but I wouldn't say that the problem is fixed.
This is an aspectj bug so reassigning it to aspectj...

A simple search of bugzilla for 'EclipseResolvedMember.getParameterNames'
reveals bug 165885 - which is the same problem and has been fixed in the AJ
development tree.  The fix is not yet in an AJDT build.
This fix is now in the latest AJDT 1.5 dev build (for eclipse 3.3M3)
